subs.text: RSS may be coming back, at some level. Two data points: 1) @davewiner is working on a new RSS feed reader that looks promising. 2) from Scripting News: RSS is on fire again, and it's all down to SlackOps. [link]

subs.text: Interesting. E.g.: At the turn of the 20th Century, breakfast was revolutionised once again by American John Harvey Kellogg. He accidentally left some boiled maize out and it went stale. He passed it through some rollers and baked it, creating the world's first cornflake. [link]

subs.text: @joshixisjosh9 I don't understand Apple News+ business model. I assume one only gets access to a mattering of articles from a given magazine then you hit paywall. I guess it could still be an OK trade-off of value received vs cost of monthly subscription.
subs.rawText: @joshixisjosh9 I don't understand Apple News+ business model. I assume one only gets access to a mattering of articles from a given magazine then you hit paywall. I guess it could still be an OK trade-off of value received vs cost of monthly subscription.

subs.text:
There are many high quality magazines to consider for my limited subscription budget. How would people compare (for example) the merits of:

Vanity Fair
The Atlantic

I'm sure there are several equally solid candidates. Is Apple News+ a decent investment for this purpose?

@MaxWinebach Look forward to learning the quality of captured still images. How will they handle a range of focal lengths? A huge constraint of phone vs. a dedicated camera is phones must be very thin, making it very challenging for telephoto use case. Need space for optics.

subs.text: July 2

I am at best a very ill-informed onlooker, but this is fascinating. The rate of change in machine learning is hard to grasp. The stats on Google Tensor system boggle my mind. I don't think we understand where this technology trajectory may take us. @mims [link]
subs.rawText:
I am at best a very ill-informed onlooker, but this is fascinating. The rate of change in machine learning is hard to grasp. The stats on Google Tensor system boggle my mind. I don't think we understand where this technology trajectory may take us.

@mims https://t.co/Fd99oJ1IA4

subs.text: @Neil_Sarg Pixel 6a has one GIANT missing feature: wireless charging. USB-C port on my  15 month old Pixel 4a 5G is so worn I struggle (!!) to get it to charge. No joy. I want/NEED wireless charging, period. But Nothing doesn't yet have model with USA radio bands.

subs.text: Overwintering monarch butterflies in Mexico are an awesome site. Although the clusters are much smaller, overwintering monarchs at multiple sites in California including Pismo Beach State Park near me, are inspiring. This robot hummingbird is pretty cool! [link]
subs.rawText:
Overwintering monarch butterflies in Mexico are an awesome site. Although the clusters are much smaller, overwintering monarchs at multiple sites in California including Pismo Beach State Park near me, are inspiring.

This robot hummingbird is pretty cool! https://t.co/UGiqbMBb9C
